a_nodesa.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*****************************************************************************
00002 
00003   Description: This file contains C routines that create and manipulate
00004                aggregate nodes on an ODL tree.
00005  
00006   Author:  Randy Davis, University of Colorado LASP
00007  
00008   Creation Date:  30 August 1990
00009   Last Modified:  18 May 1991
00010 
00011   History:
00012 
00013     Creation - This set of routines was introduced in Version 2.0 of the
00014     ODLC library, replacing the similar set of routines available in
00015     Version 1 for manipulating object nodes.
00016       a) The routines NewAggregate, RemoveAggregate, FindAggregate,
00017          NextAggregate and ParentAggregate replace the routines NewObject,
00018          RemoveObject, FindObject, NextObject and ParentObject that were
00019          part of Version 1 of the ODLC library.
00020       b) The function performed by the Version 1 routine NewODLTree
00021          has been folded into routine NewAggregate.
00022       c) New routines FindNextAggregate, CopyAggregate, CutAggregate and
00023          PasteAggregate have been added to provide services useful for
00024          label editors and similar programs.
00025 
00026     Version 2.1 - 13 March 1991 - Randy Davis, U. of Colorado LASP
00027       a) Updated routines for cutting, copying and pasting aggregate nodes
00028          and modified some of the existing routines to take advantage of
00029          them.
00030       b) Added handling for the comment and application-specific fields
00031          that were added to aggregate nodes in Version 2.1.
00032       c) Added routine NextSubAggregate to improve navigation capabilities.
00033 
00034   Version 2.2 - 18 May 1991 - M. DeMore, Jet Propulsion Laboratory
00035     Removed include statements that were Unix specific and placed them
00036     in odldef.h.
00037 
00038 *****************************************************************************/
00039 
00040 #include <stdlib.h>
00041 #include "odldef.h"
00042 #include "odlinter.h"
00043 
00044 
00045 
00046 
00047 /*****************************************************************************
00048 
00049   Routine: NewAggregate
00050  
00051   Description: Inserts a new aggregate node into an ODL tree.                 
00052  
00053   Input:
00054           base_node   - A pointer to the node that will become the parent
00055                         of the new aggregate we are creating.  If this pointer
00056                         is NULL, then the new node will be a root node for
00057                         a new ODL tree.
00058           kind        - Kind of node: object (KA_OBJECT) or group (KA_GROUP).
00059           name        - Pointer to a character string containing the new
00060                         node's name.  A non-null name must be provided.
00061           classType   - If the new aggregate node is an object node, this
00062                         character string contains the object's class.  It
00063                         may be NULL or a null string ("") if the class in
00064                         not specified. This argument is ignored for group
00065                         nodes.
00066  
00067   Output: A pointer to the new aggregate node is returned as the function
00068           value. A value of NULL indicates that the new node could not be
00069           created, probably due to a lack of dynamic memory.  A NULL value
00070           will also be returned if the name argument is NULL.
00071 
00072 *****************************************************************************/
00073  
00074 
00075 AGGREGATE NewAggregate (
00076 
00077      AGGREGATE       base_node,
00078      AGGREGATE_KIND  kind,
00079      char           *name,
00080      char           *classType)
00081 
00082 {
00083   AGGREGATE  node;             /* Pointer to the new aggregate node         */
00084   char      *string;           /* Pointer to created character string       */
00085 
00086 
00087   if (name == NULL)
00088     {
00089       return (NULL);
00090     }
00091 
00092   /* Allocate memory for the new aggregate node */
00093 
00094   node = (AGGREGATE) malloc (AGGREGATE_NODE_SIZE);
00095   if (node == NULL)
00096     {
00097       /* Error: couldn't get memory to hold this node */
00098 
00099       return (NULL);
00100     }
00101 
00102   /* Set the node kind */
00103 
00104   node->kind = kind;
00105 
00106   /* Copy the node name */
00107 
00108   string = (char *) malloc (strlen (name)+1);
00109   if (string == NULL)
00110     {
00111       /* Error: probably no memory available for name string. Free up
00112          all space and return */
00113 
00114       free (node);
00115       return (NULL);
00116     }
00117 
00118   node->name = strcpy (string, name);
00119 
00120   /* Copy the class name.  If this is a group node, or if it is an
00121      object node but with no class name specified, then set the
00122      class name to a null string */
00123 
00124   if (kind == KA_OBJECT && classType != NULL)
00125     {
00126       string = (char *) malloc (strlen (classType)+1);
00127       if (string != NULL)
00128         {
00129           node->objClass = strcpy (string, classType);
00130         }
00131     }
00132   else
00133     {
00134       string = (char *) malloc (1);
00135       if (string != NULL)
00136         {
00137           node->objClass = strcpy (string, "");
00138         }
00139     }
00140 
00141   if (string == NULL)
00142     {
00143       /* Error: couldn't store class name, probably because of lack
00144          of memory.  Free up all space and return */
00145 
00146       free (node->name);
00147       free (node);
00148       return (NULL);
00149     }
00150        
00151   /* Indicate no comment present as yet and initialize the
00152      application-specific fields  */
00153 
00154   node->comment = NULL;
00155   node->appl1   = 0;
00156   node->appl2   = 0;
00157 
00158   /* Indicate that there are no children of this node yet */
00159 
00160   node->first_child    = NULL;
00161   node->last_child     = NULL;
00162 
00163   /* Indicate that there are no parameters for this node yet */
00164 
00165   node->first_parameter = NULL;
00166   node->last_parameter  = NULL;
00167 
00168   /* If there is a base node specified, attach the new node to it */
00169 
00170   if (base_node == NULL)
00171     {
00172       /* Make the new node a root node, with no parent or siblings */
00173   
00174       node->parent        = NULL;
00175       node->left_sibling  = NULL;
00176       node->right_sibling = NULL;
00177     }
00178   else
00179     {
00180       /* Attach the new aggregate node to the base node */
00181 
00182       PasteAggregate (base_node, node);
00183     }
00184 
00185   return (node);
00186 }
00187

00190 
00191 /*****************************************************************************
00192 
00193   Routine: RemoveAggregate
00194  
00195   Description: Removes an aggregate node and all its progeny.
00196  
00197   Input:
00198           base_node - A pointer to the aggregate node to be removed.
00199  
00200   Output: A pointer to the next aggregate node belonging to the same parent
00201           (the removed node's right sibling) is returned as function value.
00202           The NULL value is returned if there is no right sibling. The NULL
00203           value is also returned if the input argument is NULL.
00204 
00205 *****************************************************************************/
00206  
00207 
00208 AGGREGATE  RemoveAggregate (
00209 
00210      AGGREGATE   base_node)
00211 
00212 {
00213   AGGREGATE node;          /* Pointer to current node                       */
00214   AGGREGATE r_node;        /* Pointer to base nodes's right sibling         */
00215   PARAMETER parameter;     /* Pointer to nodes's attributes and pointers    */
00216 
00217 
00218   if (base_node == NULL)
00219     {
00220       return (NULL);
00221     }
00222 
00223   /* Remove all the progeny of the base node through recursive calls to
00224      this function */
00225 
00226   node = base_node->first_child;
00227 
00228   while (node != NULL)
00229     {
00230       node = RemoveAggregate (node);
00231     }
00232 
00233   /* Remove all the parameters and values attached to the base node */
00234 
00235   parameter = FirstParameter (base_node);
00236 
00237   while (parameter != NULL)
00238     {
00239       parameter = RemoveParameter (parameter);
00240     }
00241 
00242   /* Save the location to the next aggregate in sequence, if any */
00243 
00244   r_node = base_node->right_sibling;
00245 
00246   /* Cut the base node from the tree */
00247 
00248   CutAggregate (base_node);
00249 
00250   /* Free up the memory space used to hold the node and the character
00251      strings containing the node's name, class and comment */
00252 
00253   if(base_node->comment != NULL)
00254   {
00255     free (base_node->comment);
00256     base_node->comment = NULL;
00257   }
00258   if(base_node->objClass != NULL)
00259   {
00260     free (base_node->objClass);
00261     base_node->objClass = NULL;
00262   }
00263   if(base_node->name != NULL)
00264   {
00265     free (base_node->name);
00266     base_node->name = NULL;
00267   }
00268   free (base_node);
00269   base_node = NULL;
00270 
00271   /* Return a pointer to the next aggregate node in sequence, if any */
00272 
00273   return (r_node);
00274 }

00279 /*****************************************************************************
00280 
00281   Routine: ParentAggregate
00282  
00283   Description: Returns a pointer to an aggregate node's parent.  
00284  
00285   Input:
00286           base_node - A pointer to an aggregate node.
00287  
00288   Output: A pointer to the parent node.  If the base node is the root node
00289           of an ODL tree, then NULL is returned.  The NULL value is also
00290           returned if the input argument is NULL.
00291 
00292 *****************************************************************************/
00293  
00294 
00295 AGGREGATE ParentAggregate (
00296 
00297      AGGREGATE  base_node)
00298      
00299 {
00300 
00301   if (base_node == NULL)
00302     {
00303       return (NULL);
00304     }
00305   else
00306     {
00307       return (base_node->parent);
00308     }
00309 
00310 }
00311 
00312 
00313 
00314 
00315 /*****************************************************************************
00316 
00317   Routine: NextAggregate
00318  
00319   Description: Returns the aggregate node after the one pointed to by the
00320                input parameter.  The next node is determined using a preorder
00321                traversal of the tree.  Basically the scheme is as follows:
00322                  1) If the base node has children then its first child
00323                     is returned.
00324                  2) If a node has no children and is not the last child
00325                     of its parent, then the sibling to the immediate
00326                     right is returned.
00327                  3) Otherwise move to the node's parent and go back to
00328                     step 2.
00329                  4) If there is no next node then the value NULL will
00330                     be returned.
00331  
00332   Input:
00333           base_node  - A pointer to the starting aggregate node.
00334  
00335   Output: A pointer to the next node is returned as the function value.
00336           A NULL value indicates that there is no next node.  The NULL
00337           value is also returned if the input argument is NULL.
00338 
00339 *****************************************************************************/
00340  
00341 
00342 AGGREGATE NextAggregate (
00343 
00344      AGGREGATE    base_node)
00345 
00346 {
00347   AGGREGATE  node;                    /* Pointer to the next node           */
00348 
00349 
00350   if (base_node == NULL)
00351     {
00352       return (NULL);
00353     }
00354 
00355   node = base_node;
00356 
00357   /* Check to see if the base node has children. If it does then
00358      return the base nodes's first child  */
00359 
00360   if (node->first_child != NULL)
00361     {
00362       node = node->first_child;
00363     }
00364   else
00365     {
00366       /* Search for a node in the ancestral path that has a
00367          right sibling and return that sibling */
00368 
00369       while (node != NULL)
00370         {
00371           if (node->right_sibling != NULL)
00372             {
00373               node = node->right_sibling;
00374               break;
00375             }
00376 
00377           node = node->parent;
00378         }
00379     }
00380 
00381   return (node);
00382 }
00383 
00384 
00385 
00386 
00387 /*****************************************************************************
00388 
00389   Routine: NextSubAggregate
00390  
00391   Description: Returns the next aggregate node after the starting node that
00392                is a sub-node of the base node.  The nodes are visited in
00393                pre-order.  If there are no more sub-nodes of the base
00394                node, the NULL value is returned.
00395  
00396   Input:
00397           base_node  - A pointer to the base aggregate node.
00398           start_node - A pointer to the aggregate node for which the
00399                        next node is desired.  The start node must
00400                        be the base node or a sub-node of the base node.
00401  
00402   Output: A pointer to the next node is returned as the function value.
00403           A NULL value indicates that there is no next sub-node for the
00404           base node.  The NULL value is also returned if either of the
00405           input arguments are NULL.
00406 
00407 *****************************************************************************/
00408  
00409 
00410 AGGREGATE NextSubAggregate (
00411 
00412      AGGREGATE   base_node,
00413      AGGREGATE   start_node)
00414 
00415 {
00416   AGGREGATE  node;                    /* Pointer to the next node           */
00417 
00418 
00419   if (base_node == NULL || start_node == NULL)
00420     {
00421       return (NULL);
00422     }
00423 
00424   node = start_node;
00425 
00426   /* Check to see if the start node has children. If it does then
00427      return the start nodes's first child  */
00428 
00429   if (node->first_child != NULL)
00430     {
00431       node = node->first_child;
00432     }
00433   else
00434     {
00435       /* Search for a sub-node of the base node that has a
00436          right sibling and return that sibling */
00437 
00438       while (node != NULL)
00439         {
00440           if (node == base_node)
00441             {
00442               node = NULL;
00443               break;
00444             }
00445           else if (node->right_sibling != NULL)
00446             {
00447               node = node->right_sibling;
00448               break;
00449             }
00450 
00451           node = node->parent;
00452         }
00453     }
00454 
00455   return (node);
00456 }

00460 
00461 /*****************************************************************************
00462 
00463   Routine: FindAggregate
00464  
00465   Description: Finds a node with a specified name.  The search starts
00466                with the base node and continues as necessary with all
00467                of the base nodes's children, all their children, and
00468                so on using a preorder search.
00469  
00470   Input:
00471           base_node - A pointer to the starting aggregate node.
00472           name      - Pointer to a character string with the name of
00473                       the node to be located.
00474  
00475   Output: A pointer to the first node that has the specified name.  If no
00476           match is found, then the NULL value is returned. The NULL value
00477           is also returned if either of the input arguments is NULL.
00478 
00479 *****************************************************************************/
00480  
00481 
00482 AGGREGATE FindAggregate (
00483 
00484      AGGREGATE   base_node,
00485      char       *name)
00486 
00487 {
00488   AGGREGATE  node;                    /* Pointer to current node           */
00489 
00490 
00491   if (base_node == NULL || name == NULL)
00492     {
00493       return (NULL);
00494     }
00495 
00496   /* Start searching with the base node and stop searching when we
00497      find a node with the specified name or when we have visited
00498      all of the sub-nodes of the base node  */
00499 
00500   node = base_node;
00501 
00502   while (node != NULL && strcmp (node->name, name) != 0)
00503     {
00504       node = NextSubAggregate (base_node, node);
00505     }
00506 
00507   return (node);
00508 }
00509 
00510 
00511 
00512 
00513 /*****************************************************************************
00514 
00515   Routine: FindNextAggregate
00516  
00517   Description: This routine is similar to routine FindAggregate in that it
00518                searches the progeny of the specified base node, except that
00519                the search begins with the node specified by the second
00520                argument. This is useful when there is more than one node
00521                with the same name in the search path.
00522 
00523   Input:
00524           base_node  - A pointer to the base node for the search.
00525           start_node - A pointer to the starting node for the search. The
00526                        search does not include the start node.
00527           name       - Pointer to a character string with the name of the
00528                        node to be located. 
00529  
00530   Output: A pointer to the next node that has the specified name. If no
00531           match is found, then the NULL value is returned.  The NULL
00532           value is also returned if any of the input arguments are NULL.
00533 
00534 *****************************************************************************/
00535  
00536 
00537 AGGREGATE FindNextAggregate (
00538 
00539      AGGREGATE    base_node,
00540      AGGREGATE    start_node,
00541      char        *name)
00542 
00543 {
00544   AGGREGATE  node;                    /* Pointer to current node           */
00545 
00546 
00547   if (base_node == NULL || start_node == NULL || name == NULL)
00548     {
00549       return (NULL);
00550     }
00551 
00552   /* Start searching with the first node after the start node and stop
00553      searching when we find a node with the specified name or when we
00554      have visited all of the sub-nodes of the base node  */
00555 
00556   node = NextSubAggregate (base_node, start_node);
00557 
00558   while (node != NULL && strcmp (node->name, name) != 0)
00559     {
00560       node = NextSubAggregate (base_node, node);
00561     }
00562 
00563   return (node);
00564 }

00568 
00569 /*****************************************************************************
00570 
00571   Routine: CutAggregate
00572  
00573   Description: Detaches an aggregate node, along with its parameters and all
00574                of it progeny, from an ODL tree.
00575  
00576   Input:
00577           base_node - A pointer to the aggregate node to be cut.
00578  
00579   Output: A pointer to the cut node is returned as the function value.  The
00580           value will be NULL if the input argument is NULL.
00581 
00582 *****************************************************************************/
00583  
00584 
00585 AGGREGATE CutAggregate (
00586 
00587      AGGREGATE   base_node)
00588 
00589 {
00590   AGGREGATE parent;        /* Pointer to base nodes's parent node           */
00591   AGGREGATE l_node;        /* Pointer to base nodes's left sibling          */
00592   AGGREGATE r_node;        /* Pointer to base nodes's right sibling         */
00593 
00594 
00595   if (base_node == NULL)
00596     {
00597       return (NULL);
00598     }
00599 
00600   /* Remove the base node from the tree and patch pointers in other 
00601      nodes, as needed */
00602 
00603   parent = base_node->parent;
00604   l_node = base_node->left_sibling;
00605   r_node = base_node->right_sibling;
00606   
00607   if (l_node != NULL)
00608     {
00609       l_node->right_sibling = r_node;
00610     }
00611   else if (parent != NULL)
00612     {
00613       parent->first_child = r_node;
00614     }
00615 
00616   if (r_node != NULL)
00617     {
00618       r_node->left_sibling = l_node;
00619     }
00620   else if (parent != NULL)
00621     {
00622       parent->last_child = l_node;
00623     }
00624 
00625   /* Reset the parent and sibling pointers since this aggregate now
00626      stands alone */
00627 
00628   base_node->parent        = NULL;
00629   base_node->left_sibling  = NULL;
00630   base_node->right_sibling = NULL;
00631 
00632   return (base_node);
00633 }
00634 
00635 
00636 
00637 /*****************************************************************************
00638 
00639   Routine: CopyAggregate
00640  
00641   Description: Copy an aggregate node with all of its parameters and
00642                all of the node's progeny (and their parameters).
00643  
00644   Input:
00645           base_node - A pointer to the starting node to be copied.  This
00646                       node remains in the ODL tree.
00647  
00648   Output: A pointer to the copy of the aggregate node is returned as the
00649           function result. The result will be NULL if the input aggregate
00650           node is NULL or if there is insufficient memory available to
00651           complete the copy operation.
00652 
00653 *****************************************************************************/
00654 
00655  
00656 AGGREGATE CopyAggregate (
00657 
00658      AGGREGATE   base_node)
00659 
00660 {
00661   AGGREGATE  node_copy;      /* Pointer to copy of base node                */
00662   AGGREGATE  child_node;     /* Pointer to current child aggregate node     */
00663   AGGREGATE  child_copy;     /* Pointer to copy of current child aggregate  */
00664   PARAMETER  parameter;      /* Pointer to current parameter of base node   */
00665   PARAMETER  parameter_copy; /* Pointer to copy of current parameter        */
00666 
00667 
00668   if (base_node == NULL)
00669     {
00670       return (NULL);
00671     }
00672 
00673   /* Create a new aggregate node for the copy */
00674 
00675   node_copy = NewAggregate (NULL, base_node->kind,
00676                             base_node->name, base_node->objClass);
00677   if (node_copy == NULL)
00678     {
00679       /* Error: couldn't make a copy of the base node, probably
00680          because we ran out of memory */
00681 
00682       return (NULL);
00683     }
00684 
00685   /* Copy the comment attached to the node, if any */
00686 
00687   CommentAggregate (node_copy, base_node->comment);
00688 
00689   /* Copy all the aggregates's parameter nodes and their values and
00690      attach them to the aggregate node */
00691 
00692   parameter = FirstParameter (base_node);
00693 
00694   while (parameter != NULL)
00695     {
00696       parameter_copy = CopyParameter (parameter);
00697       PasteParameter (node_copy, parameter_copy);
00698 
00699       parameter = NextParameter (parameter);
00700     }
00701 
00702   /* Call this routine recursively to copy all of the children
00703      aggregate nodes */
00704 
00705   child_node = base_node->first_child;
00706 
00707   while (child_node != NULL)
00708     {
00709       /* Make a copy of the current child node */
00710 
00711       child_copy = CopyAggregate (child_node);
00712       if (child_copy == NULL)
00713         {
00714           /* Error: we apparently ran out of memory while copying.
00715              Rather than leave the copy operation only partially
00716              complete, we release all space used and return */
00717 
00718           RemoveAggregate (node_copy);
00719           return (NULL);
00720         }
00721 
00722       /* Attach the copied child node to the copy of the base node */
00723 
00724       PasteAggregate (node_copy, child_copy);
00725 
00726       child_node = child_node->right_sibling;
00727     }
00728 
00729   return (node_copy);
00730 }
00731 
00732 
00733 
00734 /*****************************************************************************
00735 
00736   Routine: PasteAggregate
00737  
00738   Description: Attach an aggregate node (along with its parameters and
00739                all of its progeny aggregate nodes) to the specified
00740                aggregate node.
00741  
00742   Input:
00743           base_node - A pointer to the node that will become the parent
00744                       to the inserted node.
00745    
00746           aggregate - A pointer to the aggregrate node to be attached.
00747  
00748   Output: A pointer to the attached aggregate node is returned as the
00749           function value.  If either of the input arguments is NULL,
00750           the NULL value will be returned.
00751 
00752 *****************************************************************************/
00753  
00754 
00755 AGGREGATE PasteAggregate (
00756 
00757      AGGREGATE   base_node,
00758      AGGREGATE   aggregate)
00759 
00760 {
00761   AGGREGATE  old_last;         /* Pointer to previously last child node     */
00762 
00763 
00764   if (base_node == NULL || aggregate == NULL)
00765     {
00766       return (NULL);
00767     }
00768 
00769   /* Attach the new node to the base node, updating the pointers
00770      in the previous and next aggregate nodes as necessary  */
00771 
00772   old_last = base_node->last_child;
00773   if (old_last != NULL)
00774     {
00775       old_last->right_sibling = aggregate;
00776     }
00777 
00778   base_node->last_child = aggregate;
00779   if (base_node->first_child == NULL)
00780     {
00781       base_node->first_child = aggregate;
00782     }
00783 
00784   aggregate->parent         = base_node;
00785   aggregate->left_sibling   = old_last;
00786   aggregate->right_sibling  = NULL;
00787 
00788   return (aggregate);
00789 }
